comment:
I believe everything mentioned in these videos, (and I have seen most of them!) my only doubt so far is the interconnecting "secret" doors linking the condos. They sound "plausible", but is there any evidence of these secret doors? The court will need to see evidence of this. The reason I'm asking, is because legally speaking; from a construction point of view, such interconnecting "secret" doorways are NOT legal, as every condo is fire-isolated. If there's a fire in one condo, the separating walls need to be lined with a special "fire-retardant panel" which slows the flames down and contains the fire to that particular condo, giving enough time for the fire departments to come and control the fire. This saves lives. Such fire-isolation panels are tested and rated for an hour or sometimes two hours, meaning the walls must be rated with a certain fire-rating number to give the adjacent occupants enough time to evacuate.


EDIT: This means the walls between condos are thicker, because they are BOTH structurally load-bearing AND fire-retardant at the same time.


Creating a secret door way built/installed before or after construction "voids" this fire isolation rating, which in turn "voids" insurance, and is why such interconnecting doorways are NEVER legal, at least not in recent years. If we go back 30+ or 40+ years, maybe. These interconnecting "secret" doorways might need to be checked and established as actual existing elements for a part of the "speculation" within story to work credibly.
author: Gus Diaz

comment:
advice on editing with large files: i have a somewhat older pc so whenever i edit and my video becomes kind of long my editing software also bugs out. i found that what helps is creating 10 minute files instead, rendering them into a mp4, and then putting all the 10 minute mp4 clips together in 1 file. 


for example: if i'd have a 50 minute video, i would start editing file 1, make it about 10 minutes, export it to a mp4 and then redo the process til the entire video is made. in the end i will have 5 mp4 files, which i then all put together in 1 editing file and export it into the final mp4 and voila i have a 50 minute video without my software lagging :)


it's kind of a work around but it works and makes me less salty and anxious when editing! maybe it will help you in the future idk. thanks for your videos btw‚úå your research is amazing!

("...he‚Äôs blind in one eye and near-sighted in the other. It wasn‚Äôt until a 2013 interview in Rolling Stone magazine that he revealed his visual impairment. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve never had proper vision,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúEverything is just very, very blurry.‚Äù"
 Source: https://www.perkins.org/stories/8-celebrities-with-vision-loss).

According to Amber, JD was drunk when he arrived at the apartment. A drunk with poor vision throwing a phone at somebody would certainly miss the mark. If ever the phone hit her, she would have suffered a contusion or a wound, not just a reddening of the part of her face.

author: Miss S.

comment:
I just watched your other video on this, and subscribed part way through. I absolutely concur with your research and assessment. However, as someone who really did have a violent ex/stalker, I can understand writing a text just saying ‚Äúcan you come over?‚Äù. I can imagine myself having sent a text like that back when I was in danger, because the friend I‚Äôd send it to would probably already understand that I‚Äôm at risk of being harmed, so it wouldn‚Äôt need to be said. Writing a message like that is also quicker to write than an explanation of what‚Äôs going on. Finally, abusers don‚Äôt like it when their victims tell people that they are being abused, and they will often become more violent if they find out that the victim has confided in someone, or asked for help. Sending an ‚Äúambiguous‚Äù message like that ensures that a friend who already knows what‚Äôs going on knows that they need to be there, but it also saves the victim from the abuser‚Äôs wrath (or at least, their wrath getting any worse) if they look at the phone or demand to see the text. I also disagree that writing ‚ÄúCan you come over?‚Äù Is ambiguous. In my opinion, it isn‚Äôt - especially not when the recipient already knows that the sender is in an abusive relationship. When people want friends to come over, they‚Äôll write ‚ÄúDo you want to come over?‚Äù, or ‚ÄúLet‚Äôs get together‚Äù, and they usually include more of an explanation.

All that being said, I believe that the evidence shows Amber to be the abuser, and Johnny the abused. I‚Äôm not disputing that - I‚Äôm just trying to explain that a victim sending a text like that - to a friend who knows what‚Äôs going on - is not necessarily odd, or abnormal, given the situation. I never sent a text like that myself, because I never wanted to put any of my friends in danger, but I can understand why a victim would write such a message, instead of something more dramatic and explicit.

author: Loretto Ponton

comment:
yes its weird 25 mins - typo. 'him' vs 'his'. Amber's legal docs have at least one other typo in the highlights you have shown up to this point in the video. As a professional writer & editor, my two sense is - 1. no one bothered to proofread that friggin doc. 2. It contains obvious draft material. Why? This section you highlight at 25:20 approx. I actually stopped it to look at it and started to wonder how the F*K someone makes a typo like that without it actually being an overlooked part of a previous draft sentence/sentences that would have had to employ 'him' instead of 'his'. 

The two statements are kind of conflated as well. It just really caught me... and made me wonder what was the source material for this document. Why wasn't the section that describes the most serious allegations proofread to ensure consistency?

Then I played it and you asked if anyone else thought it was odd that Depp grabs the phone twice.

Yes. Yes it is. This looks to me like poorly resolved draft material. This section with this claim has not been resolved or consolidated. It must have come from a previous draft that needed another workover or two. It would be more accurate to strike the section that says 'then grabbed the cell phone' to say 'Johnny wound up *his"* arm like a ....¬†As a claim in a legal setting it certainly raises more questions... And I'm not even to the end of this video!

comment: You have more investigative forensics than the police. Johnny Depp would probably be surprised how you pieced this together. Amber really gave a statement with holes in it from the start. But in the era of the metoo movement they didn‚Äôt even care to know if he was actually guilty. The accusation alone was enough to end his career. As a woman & survivor of sexual assault. This sickens me. The metoo movement has to reign it in. There has to be boundaries. People cannot be judged on an accusation. Not only did Amber Heard lie, but SHE was the actual abuser. What will the movement do now? How will America react to her after this is made mainstream news? Change is good. But innocent until proven guilty must still apply TO EVERYONE.

author: Open Social

comment:
Brilliant videos, minimal speculation and good evaluation.  They must have taken a huge amount of work. 

I would like to add something incredibly sad but possibly pertinent. On page 6 of the filing for the defamation suit it is mentioned that a lot of the "new" evidence was gathered at the time but has only recently come into Mr Depp's possession. There was another legal case involving his lawyers and business managers where the implication was between them saying he mishandled and lost his money and them having mismanaged it and stolen from him. It was settled out of court confidentially. I suspect part of the agreement was that they handed over anything pertaining to him, which would be why he now has new evidence to clear his name. If true they sat on evidence that could have presented the case very differently to the public. It looks like he was surrounded by people who may not have had his best intetests at heart at that time and I hope that has now changed.
